etymology.description: 中(central) + 南(south) + 海(sea) = name formed from the 'Central Sea' and 'South Sea' lakes.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to the Zhonghai and Nanhai lakes west of the Forbidden City in Beijing; by extension, the central government leadership compound and a metonym for China’s top leadership.

parts.english: south; southern; southward; to the south of
sea; large lake; maritime; great number

examples.chinese: 中南海位于北京西城区，紧邻故宫西侧(中南海位於北京西城區，緊鄰故宮西側)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngnánhǎi wèi yú Běijīng Xīchéng Qū, jǐnlín Gùgōng xī cè.
examples.english: Zhongnanhai is in Beijing’s Xicheng District, right next to the west side of the Forbidden City.

examples.chinese: 它常被用作中国最高领导层的代称(它常被用作中國最高領導層的代稱)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cháng bèi yòngzuò Zhōngguó zuìgāo lǐngdǎo céng de dàichēng.
examples.english: It is often used as a metonym for China’s top leadership.

examples.chinese: 名称源自“中海”和“南海”两座相连的湖(名稱源自「中海」和「南海」兩座相連的湖)。
examples.pinyin: Míngchēng yuánzì “Zhōnghǎi” hé “Nánhǎi” liǎng zuò xiānglián de hú.
examples.english: The name comes from the two connected lakes called Zhonghai and Nanhai.
